pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:0.3: The chapter on offenses entailing confession
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:0.5: 6. The training rule on attending on
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.1: At one time the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.2: a government official called Ārohanta became a monk
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.4: On one occasion that monk was having his meal in the presence of that nun.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.5: While he was eating, she attended on him with drinking water and a fan, and she flirted with him.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.9: “Before you did such and such to me, but now you can’t even take this much.”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.10: And she dropped the water vessel on its head and struck him with the fan.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.11: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.12: “How could a nun hit a monk?” …
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.13: “Is it true, monks, that a nun did this?”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.16: “How could a nun hit a monk?
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.18: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:1.19.1: ‘If, when a monk is eating, a nun attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.’”
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.4: … The nun who has been given the full ordination in unanimity by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.8: is eating any of the five cooked foods.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.1.14: if she stands within arm’s reach, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.1: If he is fully ordained, and she perceives him as such, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.2: If he is fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.3: If he is fully ordained, but she does not perceive him as such, and she attends on him with drinking water or a fan, she commits an offense entailing confession.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.4: If she attends on him from beyond arm’s reach, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.5: If she attends on him when he is eating fresh food, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.6: If she attends on one who is not fully ordained, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.7: If he is not fully ordained, but she perceives him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.8: If he is not fully ordained, but she is unsure of it, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.2.9: If he is not fully ordained, and she does not perceive him as such, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.3: if she has someone else give something;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.4: if she asks someone who is not fully ordained to do it;
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.6: if she is the first offender.
pli-tv-bi-vb-pc6:2.3.7: The sixth training rule is finished.
